page.title: 05OAKLANDS RIDING SCHOOL.
page.content: The farm owned by the well known show jumper Tony Newbury, who trains and rides many champions, was once a 200 to 300 acre site under the care of Alf Newbury, Tony's father who died in l981. The farm included much of the Marsh Barton trading estate but this has gradually been sold off for building land and is now only about 14 acres. The stables house 65 horses, half of which are used for show jumping, while others are used for training people who come to the school. One of the school's employees said she wouldn't be surprised if the rest was sold off for building land over the next few years. The farm house is now flats while the family has recently moved into a new smaller bungalow.
